snippet: A South Korean court convicted the former intelligence chief of illegally helping President Park Geun-hye in the 2012 presidential election.
abstract: South Korean appeals court sentences former intelligence chief Won Sei-hoon to 3 years in prison for using his office to smear rivals of Pres Park Geun-hye during 2012 election; Park, who has taken political hit for conviction, won by only 3.5 percent or 1 million votes.
lead_paragraph: A South Korean court convicted the former intelligence chief of illegally helping President Park Geun-hye in the 2012 presidential election.

headline.main: Former Spy Chief in South Korea Sentenced in Election Case
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Ex-Spy Chief Convicted for Role in Vote
